meanings.definition: The separation of a population or species into distinct populations due to geographical barriers.
meanings.sent1: The vicariance of the birds led to the formation of two separate groups.
meanings.sent2: The vicariance of the river caused the fish to evolve differently on each side.
meanings.sent3: The vicariance of the ants made them take different paths around the rock.
meanings.sent4: The vicariance of the clouds created unique patterns in the sky.
meanings.sent5: The vicariance of the trees made each side of the forest look distinct.

meanings.definition: The process of speciation that occurs when a population is divided by a physical barrier.
meanings.sent1: Scientists study vicariance to understand how new species form.
meanings.sent2: The vicariance of the island led to the evolution of diverse plant species.
meanings.sent3: The vicariance of the cookies on the plate made it hard to choose one.
meanings.sent4: The vicariance of the students in the classroom created unique learning opportunities.
meanings.sent5: The vicariance of the road divided the town into two distinct neighborhoods.
